comments:
Tried to create a new AspectJ Project from File->New.  Got the following 
failure notice:

The selected wizard could not be started.

Reason: 
   Plug-in org.eclipse.ajdt.ui was unable to load class
org.eclipse.ajdt.internal.ui.wizards.AspectJProjectWizard.

This is using the 3.0 M5 with the recent 1.1.4 ajdt release.

Let me know what else I can do to help.

THanks,
Alex Karasulu

Hi,

I had the exact same problem. The log showed that the original exception was:
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/jface/text/ITextViewer

So I added a required plugin in the org.eclipse.ajdt.ui_0.6.4 plugin.xml.
Just added <import plugin="org.eclipse.jface.text"/> and now it works!

Hope it helps,
Laurent Cohen

I am running Eclipse 200311211210 on suse9 with sun jdk 1.4.2 and the latest
aspectj plugin (1.1.4) and I receive the same error when starting the project
wizard.

Unfortunately, AJDT 1.1.4 works only with Eclipse 3M4 or earlier.
To work with Eclipse 3M8, AJDT 1.1.7 is required, which will be available soon.
Eclipse versions between 3M4 and 3M8 are not supported.

AJDT 1.1.7 has been released which works on Eclipse 3.0M8 and the AJDT 
download page on the website has been updated to correctly reflect which AJDT 
versions work with which Eclipse versions.
Now fixed in 1.1.7 which supports M8.
